page.title: 13HARVEST, RIDDLESWORTH
page.content: Our Harvest Festival took place on Monday 7th October, l985 at Riddles- worth Church sponsored by Band Aid, a pop group who are raising money to help starving people in the Third World. Riddlesworth School gave split peas, lentils, flour, sugar and rice. We carried it into the church and packed it into sacks to be taken by road and then ship to Africa, thence to Ethiopia, Sudan and other poor countries. The church was packed as people contribted food for the poor. As the rector walked in to start the service, we sang a harvest hymn,said a short prayer and then heard a reading about the loaves and fishes. The service was held to help those who are not so well off as we are. This was our chance to help those poor starving adults and children and give them a really good Christmas.
